description.other_details: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/.

Lip GY, Frison L, Halperin JL, Lane DA. Comparative validation of a novel risk score for predicting bleeding risk in anticoagulated patients with atrial fibrillation: the HAS-BLED (Hypertension, Abnormal Renal/Liver Function, Stroke, Bleeding History or Predisposition, Labile INR, Elderly, Drugs/Alcohol Concomitantly) score. J Am Coll Cardiol. 2011;57(2):173–180. doi:10.1016/j.jacc.2010.09.024.
Pisters R, Lane DA, Nieuwlaat R, de Vos CB, Crijns HJ, Lip GY. A novel user-friendly score (HAS-BLED) to assess 1-year risk of major bleeding in patients with atrial fibrillation: the Euro Heart Survey. Chest. 2010;138(5):1093–1100. doi:10.1378/chest.10-0134.
Konstantinos Kalliamvakos, Cambio Healthcare Systems, Konstantinos.Kalliamvakos@cambio.se

details.purpose: Att registrera resultat i enlighet med HAS-BLED och därigenom få stöd i bedömning av blödningsrisk hos patienter med behandlat förmaksflimmer.
details.use:
Använd för registrering av resultat i enlighet med HAS-BLED och därigenom få stöd i bedömning av blödningsrisk hos patienter med behandlat (antikoagulantia) förmaksflimmer.
Instrumentet baseras på nio faktorer: - Hypertoni: definieras i detta fall som systoliskt blodtryck >160 mmHg. - Njurpåverka: förekomst av kronisk dialys, njurtransplantation eller ett kreatininvärde om >200 umol/L. - Leverpåverkan: kronisk leversjukdom, bilirubin >2x övre referensvärde, ASAT/ALAT >3x övre referensvärde - Tidigare genomgången stroke - Tidigare blödning, anemi eller blödningsrisk - Riskvärde PK(INR): instabilt/högt värde, inom teurapeutiskt intervall <60% av tiden - Patienten är 65 år gammal eller äldre - Koagulationshämmande läkemedel: trombocythämmande läkemedel, NSAID - Bruk av alkohol: ≥ 8 glas alkohol per vecka
details.misuse: Ej avsedd för att användas isolerat och är ej att betrakta som diagnostisk.

details.purpose: To record the results for each component parameter and their total sum for the HAS-BLED bleeding risk score.
details.use: Use to record the results for each component parameter and their total sum for the HAS-BLED bleeding risk score.

items.items: A risk assessment score to assess the bleeding risk in individuals with atrial fibrillation.

The HAS-BLED mnemonic represents each risk factor: - Hypertension, - Abnormal renal/liver function, - Stroke, -Bleeding history or predisposition, - Labile INR, - Elderly (>65), and - Drugs/alcohol concomitantly.
Default, unspecified point in time event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
The systolic blood pressure is >160 mmHg.
The presence of chronic dialysis or renal transplantation or serum creatinine ≥200µmol/L.

Chronic hepatic disease (eg. cirrhosis) or biochemical evidence of significant hepatic derangement (eg. bilirubin >2x upper limit of normal, in association with AST/ALT/ALP >3x upper limit normal, etc).
A previous history of stroke, particularly lacunar.
A previous bleeding history and/or predisposition to bleeding .
For example: bleeding diathesis, anaemia, etc.
Unstable/high INRs or poor time in therapeutic range.
The concomitant use of drugs, such as antiplatelet agents, non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, etc.
Sum of points assigned for each of the component parameters.
The risk factor is not present.
Additional information required to extend the model with local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
For example: local information requirements; or additional metadata to align with FHIR.
*A risk assessment score to assess the bleeding risk in individuals with atrial fibrillation.

*The HAS-BLED mnemonic represents each risk factor: - Hypertension, - Abnormal renal/liver function, - Stroke, -Bleeding history or predisposition, - Labile INR, - Elderly (>65), and - Drugs/alcohol concomitantly. (en)
*Default, unspecified point in time event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
*The presence of chronic dialysis or renal transplantation or serum creatinine ≥200µmol/L. (en)

*Chronic hepatic disease (eg. cirrhosis) or biochemical evidence of significant hepatic derangement (eg. bilirubin >2x upper limit of normal, in association with AST/ALT/ALP >3x upper limit normal, etc). (en)
*A previous bleeding history and/or predisposition to bleeding eg. bleeding diathesis, anaemia, etc. (en)
*Unstable/high INRs or poor time in therapeutic range (eg. <60%). (en)
*The concomitant use of drugs, such as antiplatelet agents, non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, etc. (en)
*Sum of points assigned for each of the component parameters. (en)
*Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms. (en)
*For example: local information requirements; or additional metadata to align with FHIR. (en)
